channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside No 2 Montrave Road., 9th July
item.description:
Drain is no longer visible as it is covered with earth, rain water no longer drains quickly! Council workers covered this drain with their rubble and earth after a pavement repair!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montrave Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black sacks, 9th July
item.description:

item.title: Sand bags blocking a parking space, 9th July
item.description:
Every day vans park all on yellow lines, blocking emergency access and NO TICKETS WHY? Last few weeks building materials taking up nearly 2 car parking spaces. This morinng in middle or road cement mixer. Not many spaces on Median Road and I pay.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Median Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving slabs damaged and need re - filling Along The Oval No 10, 9th July
item.description:
Resident reporting from No10 there are gaps in between the paving slabs that need filling in asap because residents wheelchair wheels are getting stuck. This has already been reported twice & it is marked with a green spray and the weather faded the spray so the contractor who came out done outside No 12 whereas the resident had requested from No 2 to No 10 on the pavement. The road surface as you turn into Marlborough Road is also damaged please could someone look into this and resident is a wheelchair user
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willersley Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocks, 9th July

item.title: Traffic lights controlling traffic from Central Avenue stuck on red, 9th July
item.description:
Traffic lights are stuck on red for traffic entering Bellegrove Rd from Central Avenue. Phasing seems to be out between 0500 and 0700 every morning. The lights phase correctly for the main road but do not allow a green phasing for traffic joining from Central Avenue. This phasing fault only appears to be present very early in the morning, but may become the cause of a collision due to traffic having to drive against a red phasing to join Bellegrove Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 126, Bellegrove Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet
